abstract: With sales of PCs falling, Microsoft said it would lay off 5 percent of its work force, and warned that technology spending could wane for years to come.
snippet: With sales of PCs falling, Microsoft said it would lay off 5 percent of its work force, and warned that technology spending could wane for years to come.
lead_paragraph: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif. — With sales of computers deteriorating by the day, the PC industry’s dominant players — Microsoft and Intel — have arrived at the stark realization that the slump in sales could last a long time, perhaps years.

headline.main: Microsoft Slashes Jobs as Sales Fall
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Slashes Jobs As Sales Fall

abstract: The results put additional pressure on Advanced Miro Devices, which has already lost money for eight consecutive quarters and has struggled against its bigger and stronger rival, Intel.
snippet: The results put additional pressure on Advanced Miro Devices, which has already lost money for eight consecutive quarters and has struggled against its bigger and stronger rival, Intel.
lead_paragraph: Advanced Micro Devices said on Thursday that slumping demand for computer chips sent its quarterly sales down 33 percent last quarter, while its losses, though narrower, were still substantial.

headline.main: Sales Decline by One-Third at A.M.D. as It Prepares to Spin Off Manufacturing
headline.print_headline: Sales Decline by One-Third at A.M.D. as It Prepares to Spin Off Manufacturing
